title: Define core data types (Position, Maze, Solution)
intent: Create mazegen/types.py defining the Position, Maze, and Solution data types that all subsequent modules will depend on.
forbidden: Do not modify any existing files
Do not add any logic beyond type definitions
acceptance_commands: python -c "from mazegen.types import Position, Maze, Solution; p = Position(row=0, col=1); assert p.row == 0 and p.col == 1; m = Maze(width=3, height=3, seed=42, start=Position(0,0), end=Position(2,2), passages=frozenset()); assert m.width == 3; s = Solution(found=True, path=(Position(0,0),)); assert s.found and len(s.path) == 1"
notes: Use typing.NamedTuple for all three types. Position has fields: row (int), col (int). Maze has fields: width (int) — number of columns, height (int) — number of rows, seed (int) — RNG seed used for generation, start (Position) — entry cell, end (Position) — exit cell, passages (frozenset) — frozenset of (Position, Position) tuples representing open connections between adjacent cells where the first Position is always less than the second (lexicographic order by row then col). Solution has fields: found (bool) — True if a path exists, path (tuple) — tuple of Position objects from start to end; empty tuple if not found. No methods, no defaults, no validation — just plain immutable data containers.
